supporting hyperplane theorem - Supporting hyperplane is a concept in geometry.

separating hyperplane theorem - For objects lying in a plane, the separating axis theorem states that, given two convex shapes, a line onto which their projections are separate exists if and only if they do not intersect.
hyperplane definition: a figure in hyperspace corresponding to a plane in ordinary space.

decision boundary - In a statistical-classification problem with two classes, a decision boundary or decision surface is a hypersurface that partitions the underlying vector space into two sets, one for each ...
hypersurface - In geometry, a hypersurface is a generalization of the concept of hyperplane.
A hyperplane is a concept in geometry.
arrangement of hyperplanes - In geometry and combinatorics, an arrangement of hyperplanes is a finite set A of hyperplanes in a linear, affine, or projective space S.

wiki.text:
A 'hyperplane' is a concept in geometry. It is a generalization of the plane
into a different number of dimensions.

A hyperplane of an ''n''-dimensional space is a flat subset with
dimension n − 1. By its nature, it separates the space
into two half spaces.
wiki.title: hyperplane
